summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey and defense attorney Allison Stoddart regarding the identification of a JPMorgan witness for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The AUSA attaches a broadly worded subpoena to JPMorgan and coordinates scheduling for discussions.

persons.name: Allison Stoddart
persons.context: Attorney from WilmerHale representing or corresponding on behalf of JPMorgan, coordinating with the prosecution to identify a witness and obtain a trial subpoena.

persons.name: Anjan Sahni
persons.context: Attorney at WilmerHale copied on the email correspondence regarding the JPMorgan witness for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Prosecutor from the Southern District of New York handling the Ghislaine Maxwell case, sending documents and coordinating to identify a JPMorgan witness.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, which is the subject of the legal correspondence and subpoena.

connections.description: Prosecutor and defense attorney coordinating on witness identification and subpoena issuance for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
Both are attorneys at WilmerHale working together on the JPMorgan witness matter for the Maxwell case.
Comey is the prosecuting attorney in the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Subpoena to JPMorgan
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey sends a broadly worded subpoena to JPMorgan to facilitate identifying a witness for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

events.title: Initial Coordination on JPMorgan Witness
events.description: Prosecution follows up with defense attorneys to send draft exhibits and discuss identifying an appropriate witness from JPMorgan for the Maxwell trial.

keyFacts: The prosecution is seeking to subpoena a witness from JPMorgan for the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal trial.
A broadly worded subpoena was sent to JPMorgan by AUSA Maurene Comey on October 19, 2021.
Defense attorneys from WilmerHale (Allison Stoddart and Anjan Sahni) are coordinating with the prosecution on witness identification.
The correspondence indicates ongoing trial preparation in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) in October 2021.
